text: Velvalea Rodgers "Vel" Phillips (February 18, 1923 - April 17, 2018) was an American attorney and civil rights activist. She served as a local official and judge in Milwaukee, Wisconsin and as Secretary of State of Wisconsin, the first woman and African-American elected to that state position, from 1979 to 1983. Phillips died under hospice care in Milwaukee at age 95 on April 17, 2018. ==Reference== ==Other websites== *Vel Phillips | Wisconsin Historical Society *Bio of Phillips on foundation website *CV from the 1979 Wisconsin Blue Book Category:1923 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Lawyers from Milwaukee Category:American civil rights activists Category:Politicians from Milwaukee Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Vel Phillips
